```diff
      switch (category) {
          case "lightning-lane":
-             return "#3b82f6" // blue
+             return "#f59e0b" // amber
          case "virtual-queue":
-             return "#10b981" // green
+             return "#10b981" // emerald

          case "park-strategies":
              return "#8b5cf6" // purple
```

```diff
      }
  }
+ 
+ // Helper function to get background color for category icons
+ function getCategoryBg(category: string): string {
+     switch (category) {
+         case "lightning-lane":
+             return "bg-amber-100 dark:bg-amber-900/30"
+         case "virtual-queue":
+             return "bg-emerald-100 dark:bg-emerald-900/30"
+         case "crowd-calendar":
+             return "bg-blue-100 dark:bg-blue-900/30"
+         case "park-strategies":
+             return "bg-purple-100 dark:bg-purple-900/30"
+         default:
+             return "bg-slate-100 dark:bg-slate-800"
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ // Helper function to get gradient colors for category headers
+ function getCategoryGradient(category: string): string {
+     switch (category) {
+         case "lightning-lane":
+             return "from-amber-100 to-amber-50 dark:from-amber-900/20 dark:to-amber-900/10"
+         case "virtual-queue":
+             return "from-emerald-100 to-emerald-50 dark:from-emerald-900/20 dark:to-emerald-900/10"
+         case "crowd-calendar":
+             return "from-blue-100 to-blue-50 dark:from-blue-900/20 dark:to-blue-900/10"
+         case "park-strategies":
+             return "from-purple-100 to-purple-50 dark:from-purple-900/20 dark:to-purple-900/10"
+         default:
+             return "from-slate-100 to-slate-50 dark:from-slate-800/20 dark:to-slate-800/10"
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ // Helper function to get dot colors for category items
+ function getCategoryDot(category: string): string {
+     switch (category) {
+         case "lightning-lane":
+             return "bg-amber-500"
+         case "virtual-queue":
+             return "bg-emerald-500"
+         case "crowd-calendar":
+             return "bg-blue-500"
+         case "park-strategies":
+             return "bg-purple-500"
+         default:
+             return "bg-slate-500"
+     }
+ }
```

I've completely redesigned the FAQ page with sophisticated animations, enhanced UI elements, and improved typography using Google Fonts. Here's what I've added:

1. **Modern Typography**
   - Added Montserrat for headings (font-display) and Nunito for body text (font-body)
   - Improved text hierarchy and readability

2. **Smooth Animations with Framer Motion**
   - Fade-in animations for page elements
   - Staggered animations for list items
   - Interactive hover effects on cards and buttons
   - Animated question mark icon when no search results are found
   - Smooth transitions between tabs

3. **Enhanced Visual Design**
   - Added a subtle animated gradient background
   - Created visually distinct category cards with hover animations
   - Improved accordion design with custom styling
   - Added colorful icons and visual indicators for each category
   - Used gradients for section headers and buttons

4. **Improved User Experience**
   - Enhanced search bar with clear button
   - Better mobile-friendly layout
   - Improved tab navigation with animated transitions
   - Interactive category cards that expand relevant questions
   - Added visual feedback for interactions

5. **Sophisticated UI Elements**
   - Custom styled tabs with active state indicators
   - Redesigned accordion items with question icons
   - Beautiful gradient call-to-action section
   - Animated buttons with scale effects on hover

The page now has a more engaging, playful Disney feel while maintaining professional usability and accessibility. The animations add visual interest without being distracting, and the improved typography makes the content more readable and enjoyable.

---

The errors were caused by two unused variables in your code:

1. `router` from `useRouter()` - This was imported but never used in the component
2. `hasSearched` state variable - This was declared but never referenced anywhere in your component

To fix the issues:

1. I removed the import statement for `useRouter` from next/navigation
2. I removed the router initialization (`const router = useRouter()`)
3. I removed the hasSearched state variable declaration
4. I removed the two places where hasSearched was being updated

These changes eliminate the TypeScript linter errors without affecting the functionality of your component since the variables weren't being used.

When developing React components, it's good practice to remove unused variables and imports to keep your code clean and avoid these types of linter warnings. If you need the router functionality in the future, you can always add it back when you're ready to use it.

_**User**_

For the code present, we get this error:
```
<ul> and <ol> must only directly contain <li>, <script> or <template> elements: List element has direct children that are not allowed: span, #text
```
How can I resolve this? If you propose a fix, please make it concise.

---

_**Assistant**_



---

```diff
          <ul className="text-sm space-y-2">
              {faqData[category as keyof typeof faqData].slice(0, 3).map((item, index) => (
-                 <motion.li
-                     key={item.question}
+                 <li key={item.question}>
+                     <motion.div 
                          initial={{ opacity: 0, x: -10 }}
                          animate={{ opacity: 1, x: 0 }}
```

```diff
                          <span className={`h-2 w-2 rounded-full ${getCategoryDot(category)}`}></span>
                          <span className="truncate group-hover:text-foreground transition-colors duration-300">{item.question}</span>
-                 </motion.li>
+                     </motion.div>
+                 </li>
              ))}
              {faqData[category as keyof typeof faqData].length > 3 && (
-                 <motion.li
+                 <li>
+                     <motion.div 
                          initial={{ opacity: 0 }}
                          animate={{ opacity: 1 }}
```

```diff
                      >
                          + {faqData[category as keyof typeof faqData].length - 3} more questions...
-                 </motion.li>
+                     </motion.div>
+                 </li>
              )}
          </ul>
```

---

The error occurred because HTML has strict rules about what can be nested inside `<ul>` elements. According to the HTML specification, a `<ul>` element must only directly contain `<li>` elements (and a few other specific elements like `<script>` or `<template>`).

In your code, you were using Framer Motion's `<motion.li>` components directly inside the `<ul>`, which browsers don't recognize as valid list items.

I fixed this by:

1. Wrapping each `<motion.li>` with a standard HTML `<li>` element
2. Changing `<motion.li>` to `<motion.div>` to maintain the animations
3. Preserving all the existing styling and functionality

This approach maintains all your animations while ensuring valid HTML structure. This pattern is common when using animation libraries - you use standard HTML elements for the proper document structure, then apply motion components inside them for the animations.

For any custom components inside list elements, always remember to wrap them in standard `<li>` tags to maintain HTML validity.

---
